metadata.name: Bourbon Street Geometry
metadata.description:
Shortly after Hurricane Ida ripped across Louisiana, the company I worked for at the time deployed me to New Orleans on a work assignment to conduct environmental assessments for buildings in the areas that Ida hit the hardest. One of those assignments included the Carnival Cruise Port and Customs building.

I captured this scene on the famous Bourbon Street in New Orleans after a long day of work and just before dinner. It rained about an hour before my arrival, and there were only a few sporadic puddles left over; however, that little bit of water is all a ground-gamer needs to make some magic happen!

attributes.value: Can be used to display privately and in groups with less than 100 participants, including virtual galleries, documentaries, and essays by individuals holding the NFT. Provides no rights to create commercial merchandise, commercial distribution, or derivative works.
